actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Referred to Subcommittee on International Economic Policy and Trade.
Referred to Subcommittee on Western Hemisphere Affairs.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on International Economic Policy and Trade

official_title: A bill to remove certain trade restrictions with respect to Cuba and to otherwise provide for improved relations with Cuba.

summary.text: Amends the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 to repeal the prohibition against furnishing assistance under such Act to Cuba. Nullifies the Presidential Proclamation imposing a trade embargo against Cuba. Terminates certain regulations issued to carry out certain restrictions on trade with Cuba. Repeals the law expressing U.S. determination to contain the Cuban Government and to support self-determination for the Cuban people. Repeals the portion of the Supplemental Appropriations Act, 1982 and the portion of the Department of Defense Authorization Act, 1985 which restates such U.S. determination.

titles.title: A bill to remove certain trade restrictions with respect to Cuba and to otherwise provide for improved relations with Cuba.
